title: Cape Horn 1-4
description:
I was going to say...

Really enjoyed this. Would like to see it as a hardcover omnibus edition with each book (1-4) as a chapter.

... until I went to the Humanoids website to grab a blurb and found out they already have an oversized deluxe edition in print. Sweet!

--------------------------------------------------------------

Cape Horn 1-4 (digital)

Humanoids, 2014, 57 pages each

Written by Christian Perrissin

Illustrated by Enea Riboldi

Colored by Studio KMzero: Cosimo Lorenzo Pancini, Simone Missoni, Naomi Mallegini, Linda Cavallini

Book 1: The Eastern-Facing Bay
Book 2: In the Cormorants' Wake
Book 3: The Black Angel Of Paramo
Book 4: The Soulful Prince

The "Land of Fire" is an archipelago off the southernmost tip of the South American mainland. As the 19th century comes to a close, it is a vast and desolate land only frequented by gold diggers, English missionaries, Chilean and Argentine military, and the age-old Ona, Alacaluf, and Yamana tribes. In this unique world, where the Andean mountains plunge into the Pacific Ocean, several characters, each burdened by duty or fate, will cross paths and clash, on their journey through Cape Horn. From Christian Perrissin, writer of "El NiÃƒÂ±o," and artist Enea Riboldi
